data.title: Four things you need to know about Miss India World 2019 Suman Rao
data.meta_description: She's all set to represent the country at the Miss World pageant.
data.text:
On Saturday night, Suman Rao was crowned Miss India 2019 at a grand ceremony held at NSCI, Mumbai. The even had former Miss India Anukreethy Vyas passing down her crown to Suman, who will now represent the country at the Miss World pageant, set to be held in Pattaya, Thailand, on December 7, 2019.

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

This event was hosted by Karan Johar and Manish Paul, whereas Bollywood A-listers like Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal, Nora Fatehi and Mouni Roy set the stage on fire with their performances. While Suman was crowned Miss India, Shreya Shankar from Bihar was named Miss India United Continents 2019, Shivani Jadhav from Chhattisgarh was given the title of Miss Grand India 2019 AND Sanjana Vij from Telangana took home the title of Miss India Runner Up 2019. But coming back to Suman, here are four things you should know about the 56th Miss India:

Four things to know about Suman Rao, Miss India World 2019

1. Suman Rao was born in 1998 in Udaipur, Rajasthan. Her father, Ratan Singh Rao is a businessman where as her mother, Sushila Kanwar Rao is a homemaker. However, she has been brought up in Mumbai.

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

2. The 22-year-old did her schooling at the Mahatma Education Society in Navi Mumbai. She is now studying at the Indian Chartered Accountants of India, in New Delhi. But besides pursuing CA, Suman is also simultaneously completing her Bachelors in Commerce.

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

3. She is a trained Kathak dancer and was crowned the first runner-up in the Miss Navi Mumbai pageant in 2018. Even though she loves dancing, she claims that her passion is modelling. In an interview she said, “When you are determined to work towards a particular goal in life, every single nerve and fiber in your body starts working in the direction of a victorious journey.” She has walked for Lakme Fashion Week earlier this year and also modelled for eminent designer Manish Malhotra.
